poem:
"Ode to Eve's Brave Caucus"

In the realm of sweat and resistance,
Beneath the barbell of existence,
Steele stands taller than the brawn.
Seven souls weave a bright lyrical dawn. 

Muscles cry, yet eyes proclaim,
Through each sinew runs a vein,
Of aching human tales, forgotten plight,
Eve, turning fitness into theatre's night.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Work It Out review – keep fit drama delivers great results Playwrights are naturally drawn to the brain and heart. Rarely do plays more fully convey what it’s like to live in someone else’s body. Writer-performer Eve Steele achieves just that with all seven characters in this affecting, amusing drama with political bite. It helps that the setting is an exercise class, but beyond aching joints and new injuries, Steele examines the physical effects of". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
